title: Multiple Select Q10 Capitalization Multiple Select
prompt: Which two sentences contain an error or errors in capitalization?
feedback:
The sentence “Luminarias are traditionally used in new Mexico and other parts of the Southwest” has an error in capitalization. The state name “New Mexico” is a proper noun, and both words should be capitalized.

The sentence “While vacationing in Arizona, my Aunt was impressed by the glowing luminaria displays” also has an error in capitalization. The word “aunt” would be capitalized as part of a name, but it is not capitalized as a descriptive term. The word “my” is an indicator that the word “aunt” should not be capitalized.
